text: Raymond Henry "Ray" Bell (31 December 1925 – 19 July 2016) was a New Zealand rugby union player. A wing and fullback, Bell represented Otago at a provincial level, and was a member of the New Zealand national side, the All Blacks, from 1951 to 1952. He played nine matches for the All Blacks including three internationals. He later served as an Otago selector from 1968 to 1971. Bell served with J Force, the New Zealand occupying force in Japan, from 1946 to 1948. He died in Dunedin on 19 July 2016. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Rugby union players from Dunedin Category:People educated at King's High School, Dunedin Category:New Zealand rugby union players Category:New Zealand international rugby union players Category:Otago rugby union players Category:Rugby union fullbacks Category:Rugby union wings Category:New Zealand referees and umpires Category:New Zealand military personnel
title: Ray Bell
